revised_title: NMR Imaging of Fluids in Porous Solids: Recent Developments and Future Prospects
tldr: This article discusses the principles and applications of Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) imaging for characterizing fluids in porous solids, such as hydrocarbon reservoir rocks. The authors outline the behavior of fluids in these systems and explore the potential of NMR imaging to reveal internal structures and properties of porous solids. They present experimental results for imaging in model porous solids and natural rocks, demonstrating the capability of NMR to indirectly image the solid structures through the signal of fluids permeating the pore space. The article also addresses the spatial heterogeneity of these materials and proposes strategies for characterizing their properties.
